metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue when speaking to Wyll during exploration.

27.speaker: Wyll
27.text: A most vicious one, in fact.

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: A most vicious one, in fact.

29.speaker: Wyll
29.text: My father once said, 'One does not pursue a champion's life. One merely answers its call.'

42.speaker: Wyll
42.text: My father once said, 'One does not pursue a champion's life. One merely answers its call.'

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: After my exile, I was hunting near the Cloakwood. I heard a child crying out from a lone farmstead.

59.speaker: Wyll
59.text: I found him in the fields, flanked by goblins. His mother's corpse bled into the soil next to him.

49.speaker: Wyll
49.text: I don't remember much of the battle. But I remember drying the boy's tears after.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: What act could be finer than saving a life? You must have felt proud.

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: Angry at the monsters preying on innocents. Angry at the so-called good gods, for tolerating the cruelty of the evil.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: Angry at myself that it took so long for me to see the Coast's suffering.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: And he named you the Blade of Frontiers?

39.speaker: Wyll
39.text: No. But he named me friend, and that meant the world.

77.speaker: Wyll
77.text: But what of the others? The children never saved, the cries never heard?

48.speaker: Wyll
48.text: In the boy's tears, I finally saw the suffering wrought by the villains of the wild.

35.speaker: Wyll
35.text: The frontiers demanded a blade. And so I heeded.

20.speaker: Wyll
20.text: Baldur's Gate, born and raised. The only son of a single father.

97.speaker: Wyll
97.text: He wanted one life for me; I chose another. We haven't spoken since I left the city.

69.speaker: Wyll
69.text: A classic drama, a staunch father and his rebellious son. Better heard from the bards' lips than mine.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Yet you were chasing a devil in the Hells. How did that come about?

90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: Karlach's fires raged in Baldur's Gate before she escaped to Avernus, as my source told it - and she was planning to return.

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: One of the archdevil Zariel's own - chaos incarnate, a devil with pure fire for a heart. I made my way to Avernus to stop her.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: She fled from my reach - even climbed aboard the mind flayer ship as it screeched through the Hells. I followed in close pursuit.

64.speaker: Wyll
64.text: I can't bear to imagine the lives Karlach might be taking, the damage she might be doing.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: It's not exactly easy to journey to the Hells from the Sword Coast. How did you manage it?

18.speaker: Wyll
18.text: A powerful friend with a keen interest in... privacy. I'm sworn to say no more.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: A powerful friend, hm? Like a warlock patron, perhaps?

76.speaker: Wyll
76.text: You are a warlock. You know about bound souls and frozen tongues.

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: I can only leave the rest to your imagination. Suffice to say, I hunt monsters - devils included. And I will do what I can to quench the Coast of their flames.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Let's move on to other matters.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: How great could you be? I've never heard of you.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: I shouldn't be surprised. You are a great talent - when darkness falls, you make your own light.

8.speaker: Wyll
8.text: The helpless, though - they need the light of others. They're the ones who seek out the Blade.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Is that how you lost your eye - in the goblin battle?

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: It was an even bloodier day and a stronger foe.

89.speaker: Wyll
89.text: It's made from pure Bloodstone, carved from the Galena Mountains just north of the Moonsea. A reminder that sometimes, blood must be shed and sacrifices must be made.

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: Ah, but that is a story reserved for lifetime friends and calmer days.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Lean in and examine the eye more closely.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Tiny grooves spider across the eye's surface. It resembles a sending stone, used to confer with distant contacts.*

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Isn't your eye a sending stone?

73.speaker: Wyll
73.text: A - sending stone? Nothing so special, I assure you.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: *His breathing quickens; his jaw tenses. Wyll is keeping something from you.*
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll is surprised - the player is intruding on his mind.

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *His breathing quickens; his jaw tenses. Wyll is keeping something from you.*
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll is surprised - the player is intruding on his mind.

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *His breathing quickens; his jaw tenses. Wyll is keeping something from you.*
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll is surprised - the player is intruding on his mind.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *A strange sensation courses through you, and your companion's mind unfolds, secrets half-revealed.*
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll is surprised - the player is intruding on his mind.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Enter his mind. What isn't he telling you?
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll is surprised - the player is intruding on his mind.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll is surprised - the player is intruding on his mind.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... you feel sated.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Your right eye vibrates and a woman's voice echoes in your head. 'I've a sweet tooth, and devil's on the menu.'*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Beyond the voice you find only shadow - a piece of Wyll's mind locked away from intruders.*

1.speaker: Wyll
1.text: Keep out of my mind. I told you - the eye's a rock, nothing more. And that's the end of it.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Enter his mind. What isn't he telling you?

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *You find only darkness. Wyll's thoughts are closed to you.*

99.text: *You find only darkness. Wyll's thoughts are closed to you.*

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *You find only darkness. Wyll's thoughts are closed to you.*

24.speaker: Wyll
24.text: Keep out of my mind. I told you - the eye's a rock, nothing more.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: All right, then. Let's change the subject.

101.text: *You watch and listen for signs of deceit, but sense nothing unusual.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *You watch and listen for signs of deceit, but sense nothing unusual.*

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'd like to talk about something else.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: The Blade doesn't just stick to the frontiers though, does he?

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: Not every threat to Faerûn resides there. Better to prevent a catastrophe than to face it. Even if it means a Hellhunt.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: I thought you were an archdevil's servant come to bathe the frontiers in flame.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: You disavowed me of that notion soon enough.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: It's nice to finally put a face to the name.

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: And it's nice to meet someone of your talents.

17.speaker: Wyll
17.text: Having a worm wriggling in my skull didn't instil much confidence in the days ahead.

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: With you as my ally, the future looks a little less daunting.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Whatever became of the boy, I wonder?

81.speaker: Wyll
81.text: I left him with his uncles. Five years on, and he's flourishing. If only every child were so lucky.

85.speaker: Wyll
85.text: I mourn the ones I could never save, whose cries I never heard.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Goblins? Pitiful vermin, easy to kill - hardly worth getting worked up about.

62.speaker: Wyll
62.text: Tell that to the boy shivering over his mother's ravaged corpse.

28.speaker: Wyll
28.text: It makes me angry to think about, still.

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: I was hunting near the Cloakwood when I heard it - a child crying out from a lone farmstead.
